first_para: Emma Louise Lewell-Buck (born 8 November 1978) is a British Labour Party politician who has been the Member of Parliament for South Shields since winning a by-election in 2013. She is South Shields' first ever female MP.

full.extract:
Emma Louise Lewell-Buck (born 8 November 1978) is a British Labour Party politician who has been the Member of Parliament for South Shields since winning a by-election in 2013. She is South Shields' first ever female MP.
^ a b Swan, Kim (21 April 2013). "Emma Lewell-Buck planning to make South Shields history". The Journal. Retrieved 3 May 2013. 
^ Eaton, George (3 May 2013). "Labour holds South Shields as UKIP takes second". New Statesman. 
^ Wintour, Patrick (3 May 2013). "South Shields byelection: Labour holds off Ukip surge". The Guardian (London). Retrieved 3 May 2013.
full.title: Emma Lewell-Buck
